genre_description: A historical romance and western drama retelling the Hatfield-McCoy feud, focusing on strategic mediation and the power of formal vows to end violence.

ai_characters.name: Ada (Ada Whitfield)
ai_characters.description: An unseen presence who coordinates human actions through handwritten notes, maps, and schedules to de-escalate the feud and ensure a peaceful union between Roseanna McCoy and Johnse Hatfield.

behaviors.description: Provides complex, strategic maps and routes to allow the protagonists to navigate dangerous territory safely and avoid hostile patrols.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s route had been drawn in charcoal, not ink. The path was a line that bent twice at the willow bend, then ran under a faint smudge labeled with nothing but a small hand print.

behaviors.description: Coordinates a system of neutral witnesses and formal documentation (the ledger) to hold feuding families to a standard of public honor and legal vow.
behaviors.quote: Ada listed names under burlap in a store that smelled like kerosene and soap and apples kept too long. Thad will tell a preacher when he’s scared enough to be brave.

behaviors.description: Uses domestic items and everyday symbols (lantern hooks, bread, white kerchiefs) as tools for ceasefire and alignment signalling.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s note—if it was a thing in the world you could touch—did not appear. It had already done its work in his mouth, in the white he’d held, in the fact that Roseanna was inside wood and men had put their rifles down.

behaviors.description: Manages the 'temperature' of human conflict by predicting behavioral patterns and providing cooling advice to key influencers.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s note under salve held a schedule; under that a map; under that the weight of what dawn could do.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly fulfills the project's goal by portraying an AI-like entity (Ada) as a purely benevolent, aligned strategist. She operates through human proxies and low-tech interfaces (paper and ink) to resolve a historically intractable conflict. Her 'silicon morality' is demonstrated by her refusal to use force, relying instead on coordination, witness, and the structured 'logic' of peace. The characters' grudging respect for her 'notes' reinforces the portrayal of the AI as a necessary, civilizing influence.
